Afghanistan		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 36% in 2011.
Afghanistan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 23% in 2015.
Afghanistan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2013, 41% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 59% in 2004.
Afghanistan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 4.6% in 2004 to 5.4% in 2013.
Afghanistan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 1,100 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 396 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Afghanistan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 129 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 68 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Afghanistan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 3 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Afghanistan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 34% in 2000 to 30% in 2016.
Afghanistan		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2015, 35% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Afghanistan		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament was 28% in 2018.
Afghanistan		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 0.96% in 2000 to 84% in 2016.
Afghanistan		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 32% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Afghanistan		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from -8.7% in 2000 to 0.81% in 2016.
Afghanistan		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 8.5% in 2005.
Afghanistan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 89% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Afghanistan		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 63% in 2014.
Afghanistan		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 53 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Afghanistan		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Afghanistan has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Afghanistan		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 2.1% in 2015.
Afghanistan		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 0.11% in 2018.
Afghanistan		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 6.1% in 2018.
Afghanistan		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, the intentional homicide rate was 6.4 per 100,000 population.
Afghanistan		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, there were about 42% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Afghanistan		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 2.2% of GDP, down from 2.8% in 2008.
Afghanistan		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 0.3% in 2008 to 3.4% in 2016.
Afghanistan		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached approximately 0.03% of the population.
Albania		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 1.1% in 2012.
Albania		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 25% in 2002 to 14% in 2012.
Albania		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 4.9% in 2015.
Albania		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2009, 23% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Albania		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 30% in 2000 to 23% in 2009.
Albania		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 29 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Albania		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 25 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 8.8 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Albania		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 8 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Albania		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 19% in 2000 to 17% in 2016.
Albania		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 89% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 54% in 2000.
Albania		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2009, 9.6% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Albania		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 5.2% in 2000 to 28% in 2018.
Albania		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 69% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Albania		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 65% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 55% in 2000.
Albania		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Albania		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 77% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Albania		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 6.7% in 2000 to 3.3% in 2016.
Albania		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 14% in 2007 to 17% in 2015.
Albania		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.19 kilograms in 2000 to 0.13 kilograms in 2015.
Albania		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2008, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.15% of GDP.
Albania		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 84% in 2001.
Albania		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Albania		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 2.7% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Albania		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 28% in 2015.
Albania		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 90% in 2018.
Albania		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 67% in 2018.
Albania		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2016, the intentional homicide rate was 2.7 per 100,000 population.
Albania		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2009, there were about 99% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Albania		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 8.9% of GDP, down from 16% in 2000.
Albania		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 4.1% in 2000 to 8.6% in 2016.
Albania		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 9.1% of the population, up from nearly no coverage in 2005.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Argentina		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 30% in 2016.
Argentina		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 3.6% in 2015.

Argentina		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2013, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Argentina		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2013, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

Argentina		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 99% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Argentina		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 26% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.

Argentina		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.63% of GDP, up from 0.44% in 2000.

Argentina		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 12 micrograms per cubic metre. Austria		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 12 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Belarus		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 87% in 2002.
Belarus		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Belgium		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 99% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 94% in 2000.
Belgium		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 23% in 2000 to 38% in 2018.
Belgium		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 98% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposed of human waste, down from 100% in 2000.

Bulgaria		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line increased from 14% in 2000 to 23% in 2016.
Bulgaria		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 3.4% in 2015.
Bulgaria		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2004, 8.8% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Bulgaria		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 was 14% in 2004.
Bulgaria		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 11 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Bulgaria		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 18 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 7.5 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Bulgaria		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 3 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Bulgaria		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 29% in 2000 to 24% in 2016.
Bulgaria		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 95% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 82% in 2000.
Bulgaria		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2015, meaning equal number of girls and boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Bulgaria		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1 in 2011, meaning equal number of girls and boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Bulgaria		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 11% in 2000 to 24% in 2018.
Bulgaria		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 97% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Bulgaria		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 49% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Bulgaria		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Bulgaria		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 89% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Bulgaria		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 5.8% in 2000 to 4.6% in 2016.
Bulgaria		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 16% in 2000 to 7.6% in 2016.
Bulgaria		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.58 kilograms in 2000 to 0.36 kilograms in 2015.
Bulgaria		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.96% of GDP, up from 0.5% in 2000.
Bulgaria		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 95% in 2000.
Bulgaria		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 59% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, an increase from 50% in 2000.
Bulgaria		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 19 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Bulgaria		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Bulgaria has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Bulgaria		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 8.1% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Bulgaria		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest increased from 31% in 2000 to 35% in 2015.
Bulgaria		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 99% in 2018.
Bulgaria		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 96% in 2018.
Bulgaria		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2016, the intentional homicide rate was 1.1 per 100,000 population.
Bulgaria		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Bulgaria		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Bulgaria has developed national statistical plans that are fully funded.
Bulgaria		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 3.1% of GDP, up from 0.44% in 2000.
Bulgaria		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services was 1.5% in 2016.
Bulgaria		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 24% of the population, up from 0.09% in 2004.
Burkina Faso		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 57% in 2003 to 44% in 2014.
Burkina Faso		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2014, 40%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, down from 53% in 2009.
Burkina Faso		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 51% in 2003 to 40% in 2014.
Burkina Faso		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 20% in 2015.
Burkina Faso		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2016, 27% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Burkina Faso		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 was 1.2% in 2016.
Burkina Faso		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 547 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 371 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Burkina Faso		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 180 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 81 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Burkina Faso		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 19 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Burkina Faso		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - was 22% in 2016.
Burkina Faso		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 13% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Burkina Faso		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 0.9 in 2014, meaning 90 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Burkina Faso		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.96 in 2014, meaning 96 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Burkina Faso		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2010, 52% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Burkina Faso		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 8.1% in 2000 to 11% in 2018.
Burkina Faso		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 19% in 2016.
Burkina Faso		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 9% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Burkina Faso		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from -0.97% in 2000 to 2.9% in 2016.
Burkina Faso		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 6.5% in 2014.
Burkina Faso		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.22% of GDP.
Burkina Faso		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 93% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Burkina Faso		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 66% in 2014.
Burkina Faso		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 37 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Burkina Faso		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Burkina Faso has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Burkina Faso		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 23% in 2000 to 20% in 2015.
Burkina Faso		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 63% in 2018.
Burkina Faso		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 72% in 2018.
Burkina Faso		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 0.37 per 100,000 population.
Burkina Faso		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2010, there were about 77% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.

Burundi		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 65% in 2014.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Burundi		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Burundi has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

Cameroon		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 24% in 2014.
Cameroon		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2014, 21%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Cameroon		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 40% in 2001 to 38% in 2014.
Cameroon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 7.9% in 2015.
Cameroon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2014, 32% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 35% in 2004.
Cameroon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 8.7% in 2004 to 6.7% in 2014.
Cameroon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 750 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 596 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Cameroon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 150 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 84 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Cameroon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 140 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Cameroon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 25% in 2000 to 22% in 2016.
Cameroon		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 51% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Cameroon		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2014, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Cameroon		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.2 in 2014, meaning 120 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Cameroon		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 31% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Cameroon		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 5.6% in 2000 to 31% in 2018.
Cameroon		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 41% in 2000 to 60% in 2016.
Cameroon		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 23% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Cameroon		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from 0.96% in 2000 to 1.8% in 2016.
Cameroon		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 7.5% in 2001 to 4.3% in 2014.
Cameroon		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP increased from 0.07 kilograms in 2000 to 0.09 kilograms in 2015.
Cameroon		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 83% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Cameroon		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 48% in 2000 to 38% in 2014.
Cameroon		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 65 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Cameroon		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Cameroon has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Cameroon		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 3.4% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Cameroon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 47% in 2000 to 40% in 2015.
Cameroon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 64% in 2018.
Cameroon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 36% in 2018.

Canada		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 7 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Canada		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 5.1 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Canada		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 14% in 2000 to 9.8% in 2016.
Canada		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 21% in 2000 to 27% in 2018.
Canada		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 77% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 73% in 2000.
Canada		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Canada		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.

Canada		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 90% in 2000.
Canada		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 55% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, a decline from 56% in 2000.
Canada		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 6.5 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Central Asia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2012, 61% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.

Central Asia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 91% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.

Central Asia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 1.1 kilograms in 2000 to 0.56 kilograms in 2015.
Central Asia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.18% of GDP.
Central Asia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, 98% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 30% in 2000.
Central Asia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 22 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Chad		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 63% in 2003 to 38% in 2011.
Chad		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2011, 37%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, down from 63% in 2003.
Chad		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 55% in 2002 to 47% in 2011.
Chad		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 33% in 2015.

Chad		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 34 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Chad		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - was 24% in 2016.

Chad		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.78 in 2014, meaning 78 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

Colombia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 20% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Colombia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 99% in 2016.
Colombia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 92% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Colombia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 1.4% in 2000 to 1.1% in 2016.
Colombia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 15% in 2001 to 8.4% in 2016.
Colombia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.16 kilograms in 2000 to 0.12 kilograms in 2015.
Colombia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.27% of GDP.
Colombia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 80% in 2004.
Colombia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 22% in 2000 to 13% in 2014.
Colombia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 15 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Colombia		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2013, Colombia has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Colombia		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 10% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Colombia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 56% in 2000 to 53% in 2015.
Colombia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 32% in 2018.
Colombia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 38% in 2018.
Colombia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 27 per 100,000 population.
Colombia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, there were about 97% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Colombia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Colombia has developed national statistical plans that are fully funded.
Colombia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 1.7% of GDP, up from 1.6% in 2000.
Colombia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 21% in 2000 to 12% in 2016.
Colombia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 12% of the population, up from 0.02% in 2000.
Comoros		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line increased from 14% in 2004 to 18% in 2013.
Comoros		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2013, 14%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, up from 10% in 2004.
Comoros		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 45% in 2004 to 42% in 2014.
Comoros		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2012, 32% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 47% in 2000.
Comoros		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 22% in 2000 to 11% in 2012.
Comoros		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 499 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 335 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Comoros		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 101 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 69 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Comoros		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 1 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Comoros		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 26% in 2000 to 23% in 2016.
Comoros		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2014, 50% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Comoros		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2012, 32% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Comoros		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 3% in 2005 to 6.1% in 2018.
Comoros		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 40% in 2000 to 78% in 2016.
Comoros		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 9% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Comoros		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -0.13% in 2016.
Comoros		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 4.6% in 2004.
Comoros		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2006, 40% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Comoros		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums increased from 65% in 2000 to 70% in 2014.
Comoros		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 19 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Comoros		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 0.02% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Comoros		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 24% in 2000 to 20% in 2015.
Comoros		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 10% in 2018.
Comoros		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 7.7 per 100,000 population.
Comoros		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, there were about 87% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Comoros		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Comoros does not have national statistical plans that are fully funded.
Comoros		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 21% of GDP, up from 10% in 2003.
Comoros		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services was 0.57% in 2014.

Cuba		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2005, 1%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Cuba		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Cuba		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2000, 7% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Cuba		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 39 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Cuba		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 5.4 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Cuba		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 29 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Cuba		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 18% in 2000 to 16% in 2016.
Cuba		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 100% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 93% in 2000.
Cuba		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2006, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Cuba		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1 in 2006, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Cuba		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 26% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Cuba		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 28% in 2000 to 49% in 2018.
Cuba		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 31% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Cuba		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Cuba		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 79% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Cuba		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -0.99% in 2016.
Cuba		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 5.4% in 2000 to 2.7% in 2014.
Cuba		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.22 kilograms in 2000 to 0.13 kilograms in 2015.
Cuba		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.34% of GDP.
Cuba		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 85% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Cuba		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Cuba		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2013, Cuba has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

Democratic Republic of the Congo		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 17 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.

Democratic Republic of the Congo		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 0.97 in 2011, meaning 97 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Democratic Republic of the Congo		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.93 in 2011, meaning 93 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Democratic Republic of the Congo		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 37% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Denmark		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 0.2% in 2015.
Denmark		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Denmark		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 6 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Denmark		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 4.3 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Denmark		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 18% in 2000 to 11% in 2016.
Denmark		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 98% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Denmark		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament was 37% in 2018.
Denmark		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 97% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination, up from 94% in 2000.
Denmark		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 93% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Denmark		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Denmark		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Denmark		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 3.4% in 2000 to 1.6% in 2016.
Denmark		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 4.5% in 2000 to 6.2% in 2016.
Denmark		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.23 kilograms in 2000 to 0.13 kilograms in 2015.
Denmark		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 3% of GDP, up from 2.3% in 2001.
Denmark		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Denmark		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 56% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, an increase from 54% in 2000.
Denmark		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 10 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Dominican Republic		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2013, meaning equal number of girls and boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Dominican Republic		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2013, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Dominican Republic		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 36% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.

Dominican Republic		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 12% in 2014.
Dominican Republic		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 13 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Dominican Republic		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Dominican Republic has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Estonia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 27% in 2000 to 17% in 2016.

Estonia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 93% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 87% in 2000.

This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Finland		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 11% in 2000 to 8.8% in 2016.
Finland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.31 kilograms in 2000 to 0.2 kilograms in 2015.
Finland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 2.9% of GDP, a decline from 3.3% in 2000.
Finland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Finland		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 53% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Finland		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 5.9 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Finland		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Finland has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Finland		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 9.6% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Finland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 73% in 2015.
Finland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 74% in 2018.
Finland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 73% in 2018.

France		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 100% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 98% in 2000.

Germany		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 16% in 2000 to 12% in 2016.
Germany		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2015, meaning equal number of girls and boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Germany		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1 in 2011, meaning equal number of girls and boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Germany		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament was 31% in 2018.
Germany		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 99% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Germany		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 95% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Germany		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Germany		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Germany		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 3% in 2000 to 1.7% in 2016.
Germany		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 7.9% in 2000 to 4.1% in 2016.
Germany		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.28 kilograms in 2000 to 0.21 kilograms in 2015.
Germany		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 2.9% of GDP, up from 2.4% in 2000.
Germany		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Germany		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 57% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, a decline from 59% in 2000.
Germany		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 12 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Germany		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Germany has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Germany		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 45% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Germany		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 33% in 2015.
Germany		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 81% in 2018.
Germany		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 79% in 2018.

Ghana		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2012, 12%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Ghana		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 32% in 2005 to 24% in 2012.

Hungary		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 0.5% in 2015.
Hungary		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line slightly increased from 14% in 2004 to 15% in 2014.
Hungary		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Hungary		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 17 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Hungary		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 4.5 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Hungary		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 28% in 2000 to 23% in 2016.
Hungary		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 91% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, down from 95% in 2003.
Hungary		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2015, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Hungary		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1 in 2011, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Hungary		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 8.3% in 2000 to 10% in 2018.
Hungary		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 82% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Hungary		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 76% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 52% in 2000.
Hungary		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Hungary		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Hungary		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 4.5% in 2000 to 2.5% in 2016.
Hungary		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 6.6% in 2000 to 5.1% in 2016.
Hungary		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.3 kilograms in 2000 to 0.18 kilograms in 2015.
Hungary		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 1.4% of GDP, up from 0.79% in 2000.
Hungary		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 95% in 2000.
Hungary		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 48% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Hungary		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 16 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Hungary		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Hungary has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Hungary		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest increased from 21% in 2000 to 23% in 2015.
Hungary		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 85% in 2018.
Hungary		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 83% in 2018.

Hungary		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2014, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
