Hungary		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 3.7% of GDP, up from 0.47% in 2000.
Hungary		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 6.9% in 2005 to 10% in 2013.

Iraq		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 2.5% in 2012.
Iraq		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2012, 9.7%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Iraq		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 22% in 2006 to 19% in 2012.
Iraq		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 28% in 2015.
Iraq		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2011, 23% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Iraq		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 5.5% in 2000 to 12% in 2011.
Iraq		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 50 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Iraq		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 45 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 30 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Iraq		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 24% in 2000 to 21% in 2016.
Iraq		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2007, 18% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Iraq		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2011, 24% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Iraq		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 6.4% in 2000 to 25% in 2018.
Iraq		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 32% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Iraq		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Iraq		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Iraq		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from -1.6% in 2000 to 7.8% in 2016.
Iraq		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 28% in 2003 to 8% in 2011.
Iraq		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP were approximately 0.26 kilograms in 2015.
Iraq		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.04% of GDP.
Iraq		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, 98% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 68% in 2005.
Iraq		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums increased from 17% in 2000 to 47% in 2014.
Iraq		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 58 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Iraq		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Iraq has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Iraq		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 1.9% in 2015.
Iraq		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 5.1% in 2018.
Iraq		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 5.1% in 2018.
Iraq		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2011, there were about 99% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Iraq		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 0.58% of GDP.
Ireland		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Ireland		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 8 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Ireland		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 3.5 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Ireland		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 6 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Ireland		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 18% in 2000 to 10% in 2016.
Ireland		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 91% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Ireland		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 12% in 2000 to 22% in 2018.
Ireland		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 99% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination, up from 92% in 2000.
Ireland		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 70% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 36% in 2000.
Ireland		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Ireland		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Ireland		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 8% in 2000 to 4.6% in 2016.
Ireland		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 4.3% in 2000 to 7.9% in 2016.
Ireland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.28 kilograms in 2000 to 0.13 kilograms in 2015.
Ireland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2014, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 1.5% of GDP, up from 1.1% in 2000.
Ireland		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 98% in 2000.
Ireland		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 35% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Ireland		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 8.3 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Ireland		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 2.3% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Ireland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest increased from 9.2% in 2000 to 11% in 2015.
Ireland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 98% in 2018.
Ireland		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 90% in 2018.
Ireland		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2016, the intentional homicide rate was 0.8 per 100,000 population.
Ireland		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2014, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Ireland		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Ireland has developed national statistical plans that are fully funded.

Japan		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 4.7% in 2000 to 3.1% in 2016.
Japan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.28 kilograms in 2000 to 0.26 kilograms in 2015.
Japan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 3.3% of GDP, up from 2.9% in 2000.
Japan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Japan		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 56% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, a decline from 63% in 2000.
Japan		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 11 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Japan		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Japan has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

Kuwait		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 1.5% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Kuwait		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 0.35% in 2015.
Kuwait		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 59% in 2018.

Kyrgyzstan		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2015, 1.9% of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Kyrgyzstan		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 40% in 2006 to 25% in 2016.
Kyrgyzstan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 6.4% in 2015.
Kyrgyzstan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2014, 13% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Kyrgyzstan		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 11% in 2006 to 7% in 2014.
Kyrgyzstan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 76 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Kyrgyzstan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 50 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 20 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Kyrgyzstan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 13 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Kyrgyzstan		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 31% in 2000 to 25% in 2016.
Kyrgyzstan		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 72% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Kyrgyzstan		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 12% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Kyrgyzstan		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 1.4% in 2000 to 19% in 2018.
Kyrgyzstan		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 66% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Kyrgyzstan		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Kyrgyzstan		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 81% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Kyrgyzstan		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 4.2% in 2000 to 2.3% in 2016.
Kyrgyzstan		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 7.2% in 2016.
Kyrgyzstan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP increased from 0.45 kilograms in 2000 to 0.53 kilograms in 2015.
Kyrgyzstan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.12% of GDP.
Kyrgyzstan		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 5.2% in 2004.
Kyrgyzstan		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Least Developed Countries (LDCs)		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 12% in 2000 to 8.6% in 2016.
Least Developed Countries (LDCs)		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 1.1% of the population.
Lebanon		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 27% in 2012.
Lebanon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 5.4% in 2015.
Lebanon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2004, 17% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Lebanon		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 was 17% in 2004.
Lebanon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 15 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Lebanon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 20 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 7.8 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Lebanon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 2 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Lebanon		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 21% in 2000 to 18% in 2016.
Lebanon		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 91% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, down from 100% in 2000.
Lebanon		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2009, 6.1% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Lebanon		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament was 3.1% in 2018.
Lebanon		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 48% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Lebanon		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 20% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Lebanon		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Lebanon		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -1.6% in 2016.
Lebanon		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 7.9% in 2004 to 6.4% in 2009.
Lebanon		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.35 kilograms in 2000 to 0.3 kilograms in 2015.
Lebanon		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Lebanon		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 53% in 2014.
Lebanon		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 31 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Lebanon		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2013, Lebanon has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Lebanon		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 0.21% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Lebanon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 13% in 2015.
Lebanon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 21% in 2018.
Lebanon		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 13% in 2018.
Lebanon		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2016, the intentional homicide rate was 4 per 100,000 population.
Lebanon		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2009, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Lebanon		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 15% of GDP, up from 13% in 2002.
Lebanon		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 29% in 2002 to 20% in 2016.
Lebanon		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 22% of the population, up from 1.2% in 2007.
Lesotho		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 60% in 2010.
Lesotho		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2010, 47%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Lesotho		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 57% in 2010.
Lesotho		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 15% in 2015.
Lesotho		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2014, 33% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 53% in 2000.
Lesotho		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 21% in 2000 to 7.4% in 2014.
Lesotho		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 649 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 487 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Lesotho		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 117 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 86 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Lesotho		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 1,300 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Lesotho		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - was 27% in 2016.
Lesotho		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 36% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Lesotho		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 0.99 in 2007, meaning 99 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Lesotho		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.94 in 2006, meaning 94 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Lesotho		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 17% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Lesotho		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 3.8% in 2000 to 22% in 2018.
Lesotho		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 4.3% in 2000 to 30% in 2016.
Lesotho		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 36% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Lesotho		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 4.1% in 2000 to 1.5% in 2016.
Lesotho		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 35% in 2008 to 25% in 2013.
Lesotho		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.05% of GDP.
Lesotho		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 98% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 21% in 2002.
Lesotho		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums increased from 35% in 2005 to 51% in 2014.
Lesotho		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 28 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Lesotho		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Lesotho has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Lesotho		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 1.6% in 2015.
Lesotho		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 15% in 2018.
Lesotho		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 41 per 100,000 population.
Lesotho		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2014, there were about 43% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.

Lesotho		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 7.5% in 2000 to 4.2% in 2016.

Liberia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 64% in 2007 to 54% in 2014.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Luxembourg		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Luxembourg		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 10 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Luxembourg		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 2.6 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Luxembourg		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 18 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Luxembourg		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 15% in 2000 to 10% in 2016.
Luxembourg		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 99% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 98% in 2000.
Luxembourg		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 17% in 2000 to 28% in 2018.
Luxembourg		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 98% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Luxembourg		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 94% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Luxembourg		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Luxembourg		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Luxembourg		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 7% in 2000 to 1.5% in 2016.
Luxembourg		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 2.4% in 2000 to 6.3% in 2016.
Luxembourg		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.24 kilograms in 2000 to 0.17 kilograms in 2015.
Luxembourg		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 1.3% of GDP, a decline from 1.6% in 2000.
Luxembourg		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 98% in 2000.
Luxembourg		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 53% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Luxembourg		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 10 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Luxembourg		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 33% in 2015.
Luxembourg		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 37% in 2018.
Luxembourg		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 79% in 2018.

Madagascar		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2012, 73%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, up from 65% in 2001.
Madagascar		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 42% in 2015.
Madagascar		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2009, 49% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 53% in 2004.
Madagascar		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 was 6.2% in 2004.
Madagascar		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 536 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 353 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Madagascar		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 107 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 44 per 1,000 live births in 2017.

Madagascar		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2006, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Madagascar		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2006, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Mali		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 0.93 in 2003, meaning 93 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Mali		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.89 in 2003, meaning 89 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

Mali		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 8.8% in 2004 to 9.7% in 2016.

Mali		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 31 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Mexico		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 18% in 2000 to 43% in 2018.

Mexico		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 45% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.

Mexico		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2013, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 86% in 2000.
Mexico		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 35% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Mexico		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 11% in 2014.
Mexico		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 20 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Netherlands		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Netherlands		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 58% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers, a decline from 60% in 2000.
Netherlands		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 12 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Netherlands		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Netherlands has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

Papua New Guinea		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 11 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Paraguay		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 8.9% in 2001 to 1.7% in 2016.
Paraguay		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2015, 1.4%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Paraguay		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 58% in 2002 to 29% in 2016.
Paraguay		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 12% in 2015.
Paraguay		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2016, 5.6% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Paraguay		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 7.1% in 2005 to 12% in 2016.
Paraguay		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 158 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 132 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Paraguay		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 34 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 21 per 1,000 live births in 2017.

Paraguay		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2012, 78% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Paraguay		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2013, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Paraguay		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2013, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.

Paraguay		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 66% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.

Paraguay		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 7.6% in 2000 to 5.3% in 2016.

Paraguay		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 97% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.

Paraguay		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 11 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Peru		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 50% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.

Portugal		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 10 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Portugal		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 3.7 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Portugal		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 16% in 2000 to 11% in 2016.
Portugal		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 100% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 85% in 2001.
Portugal		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 19% in 2000 to 35% in 2018.
Portugal		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 95% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination, up from 93% in 2000.
Portugal		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 62% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Portugal		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Portugal		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Portugal		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 3.4% in 2000 to 2% in 2016.
Portugal		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 3.8% in 2000 to 11% in 2016.
Portugal		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.22 kilograms in 2000 to 0.17 kilograms in 2015.
Portugal		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 1.3% of GDP, up from 0.72% in 2000.
Portugal		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Portugal		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 52% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Portugal		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 7.9 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Portugal		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Portugal has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Portugal		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 3.8% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.

Russian Federation		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.

Russian Federation		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 19 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 7.6 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Russian Federation		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 37% in 2000 to 25% in 2016.
Russian Federation		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 96% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 88% in 2008.
Russian Federation		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2015, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Russian Federation		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1 in 2011, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Russian Federation		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 7.7% in 2000 to 16% in 2018.
Russian Federation		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 76% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Russian Federation		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Russian Federation		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Russian Federation		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -0.28% in 2016.
Russian Federation		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 11% in 2000 to 5.6% in 2015.
Russian Federation		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.81 kilograms in 2000 to 0.47 kilograms in 2015.
Russian Federation		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 1.1% of GDP.
Russian Federation		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 90% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Russian Federation		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2016, 47% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Russian Federation		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 14 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Russian Federation		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 2.9% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Russian Federation		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 50% in 2015.
Russian Federation		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 27% in 2018.
Russian Federation		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 27% in 2018.
Russian Federation		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 13 per 100,000 population.
Russian Federation		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2010, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Russian Federation		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Russian Federation has developed national statistical plans that are fully funded.
Russian Federation		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 0.52% of GDP.
Russian Federation		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 7.5% in 2000 to 8.1% in 2016.
Russian Federation		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 19% of the population, up from nearly no coverage in 2002.
Rwanda		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 77% in 2000 to 56% in 2013.
Rwanda		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2013, 57%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, down from 78% in 2000.
Rwanda		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 41% in 2015.
Rwanda		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2015, 38% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 48% in 2000.
Rwanda		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 7.2% in 2000 to 7.7% in 2015.
Rwanda		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 1,020 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 290 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Rwanda		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 181 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 38 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Rwanda		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 70 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Rwanda		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 30% in 2000 to 18% in 2016.
Rwanda		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 40% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Rwanda		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2015, 6.8% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Rwanda		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 17% in 2000 to 61% in 2018.
Rwanda		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 6.2% in 2000 to 29% in 2016.
Rwanda		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, less than 5% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Rwanda		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita increased from 2.5% in 2000 to 3.4% in 2016.
Rwanda		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 50% in 2002.
Rwanda		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 80% in 2000 to 53% in 2014.
Rwanda		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 41 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Rwanda		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Rwanda has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.

San Marino		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 13% in 2000 to 27% in 2018.

San Marino		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2016, 50% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
San Marino		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 13 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Sierra Leone		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2011, 51%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
Sierra Leone		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line declined from 66% in 2003 to 53% in 2011.
Sierra Leone		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 31% in 2015.
Sierra Leone		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2013, 38% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Sierra Leone		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 4.7% in 2000 to 8.9% in 2013.
Sierra Leone		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 2650 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 1360 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Sierra Leone		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 233 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 111 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Sierra Leone		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 86 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Sierra Leone		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 37% in 2000 to 31% in 2016.
Sierra Leone		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 30% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.

Sierra Leone		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 97% in 2005 to 76% in 2014.
Sierra Leone		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 21 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Solomon Islands		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 11 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Suriname		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 7.9% in 2015.
Suriname		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 259 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 155 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Suriname		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 35 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 20 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Suriname		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 62 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Suriname		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 28% in 2000 to 22% in 2016.
Suriname		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 97% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school, up from 88% in 2008.
Suriname		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2010, 19% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Suriname		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 16% in 2000 to 25% in 2018.
Suriname		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity declined from 97% in 2000 to 87% in 2016.
Suriname		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 90% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Suriname		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -6% in 2016.
Suriname		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 9.5% in 2004 to 7.2% in 2015.
Suriname		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.32 kilograms in 2000 to 0.25 kilograms in 2015.
Suriname		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Suriname		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 7.3% in 2014.
Suriname		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 24 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Suriname		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 1.5% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Suriname		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 98% in 2015.
Suriname		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 49% in 2018.
Suriname		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 51% in 2018.
Suriname		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2010, there were about 99% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.

Sweden		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Sweden		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 4 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Sweden		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 was 2.8 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Sweden		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 6 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Sweden		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 13% in 2000 to 9.1% in 2016.
Sweden		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 98% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Sweden		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament was 44% in 2018.
Sweden		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 98% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
Sweden		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 92% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 91% in 2000.
Sweden		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
Sweden		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Sweden		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 4.6% in 2000 to 2.5% in 2016.
Sweden		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 6% in 2000 to 7% in 2016.
Sweden		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.16 kilograms in 2000 to 0.09 kilograms in 2015.
Sweden		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 3.3% of GDP, a decline from 3.9% in 2001.
Sweden		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Sweden		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 49% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Sweden		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 5.9 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Sweden		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Sweden has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Sweden		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 15% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Sweden		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 69% in 2015.
Sweden		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 62% in 2018.
Sweden		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 59% in 2018.
