Thailand		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 44% in 2018.
Thailand		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 72% in 2018.
Thailand		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 3.5 per 100,000 population.
Thailand		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2016, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Thailand		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 1.5% of GDP.
Thailand		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services was 0.25% in 2016.
Thailand		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 10% of the population, up from nearly no coverage in 2001.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 9.7% in 2009 to 5% in 2014.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2014, 2.7%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 22% in 2015.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 3.9% in 2015.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2011, 4.9% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 16% in 2005 to 12% in 2011.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 8 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 16 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 14 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 2 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 26% in 2000 to 20% in 2016.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 44% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2011, 6.9% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 7.5% in 2000 to 38% in 2018.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 83% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity was 100% in 2016.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 66% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 4% in 2000 to 2.8% in 2016.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 32% in 2000 to 24% in 2016.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.47 kilograms in 2000 to 0.27 kilograms in 2015.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.44% of GDP.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 90% in 2000.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2014, 48% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 28 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 40% in 2015.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 86% in 2018.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 21% in 2018.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2014, the intentional homicide rate was 1.6 per 100,000 population.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2011, there were about 100% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 2.7% of GDP, up from 2.1% in 2000.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 6.6% in 2000 to 7.2% in 2016.
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 18% of the population, up from 0.6% in 2005.
Timor-Leste		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line declined from 46% in 2001 to 30% in 2014.
Timor-Leste		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 27% in 2015.
Timor-Leste		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2013, 50% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 56% in 2002.
Timor-Leste		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 5.7% in 2002 to 1.5% in 2013.
Timor-Leste		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 694 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 215 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Timor-Leste		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 108 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 48 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Timor-Leste		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 27% in 2000 to 20% in 2016.
Timor-Leste		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2016, 57% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Timor-Leste		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2010, 19% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Timor-Leste		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 26% in 2003 to 32% in 2018.
Timor-Leste		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 20% in 2000 to 63% in 2016.
Timor-Leste		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 7% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Timor-Leste		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 13% in 2000 to 2.7% in 2016.
Timor-Leste		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 11% in 2013.
Timor-Leste		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 97% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 38% in 2003.
Timor-Leste		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Timor-Leste		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 39% in 2018.
Timor-Leste		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 4 per 100,000 population.
Timor-Leste		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2010, there were about 55% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.

Tunisia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 8.8% in 2006 to 14% in 2012.
Tunisia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 62 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Tunisia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 32 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 13 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Tunisia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 3 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Tunisia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 19% in 2000 to 16% in 2016.
Tunisia		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2002, 42% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Tunisia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2012, 1.6% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Tunisia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 12% in 2000 to 31% in 2018.
Tunisia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 93% of the population used a "safely managed" drinking water service - an improved source located on premises, available when needed and free from contamination, up from 37% in 2000.
Tunisia		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 73% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste, up from 58% in 2000.
Tunisia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 95% in 2000 to 100% in 2016.
Tunisia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, more than 95% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Tunisia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -0.15% in 2016.
Tunisia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 16% in 2016.
Tunisia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.24 kilograms in 2000 to 0.21 kilograms in 2015.
Tunisia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2015, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.63% of GDP, up from 0.54% in 2002.
Tunisia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 99% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 60% in 2002.
Tunisia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums was 8% in 2014.
Tunisia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 36 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Tunisia		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Tunisia has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Tunisia		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 1% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.
Tunisia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest was 6.7% in 2015.
Tunisia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 43% in 2018.
Tunisia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 41% in 2018.
Tunisia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, the intentional homicide rate was 3.1 per 100,000 population.
Tunisia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, there were about 99% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Tunisia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 4.3% of GDP, up from 3.7% in 2000.
Tunisia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 21% in 2000 to 9.2% in 2016.
Tunisia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 5.6% of the population, up from nearly no coverage in 2002.
Turkey		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of population living below the national poverty line was 1.6% in 2015.
Turkey		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was less than 2.5% in 2015.
Turkey		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2013, 9.5% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Turkey		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 increased from 9.1% in 2004 to 11% in 2013.
Turkey		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio was 16 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Turkey		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 39 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 12 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Turkey		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 22% in 2000 to 16% in 2016.
Turkey		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2015, 69% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Turkey		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1 in 2015, meaning 100 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Turkey		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2001, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Turkey		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2013, 15% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Turkey		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 4.2% in 2000 to 15% in 2018.
Turkey		6	Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all			In 2015, 44% of the population used a "safely managed" sanitation service - a basic facility that safely disposes of human waste.
Turkey		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 95% in 2000 to 100% in 2016.
Turkey		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita declined from 5% in 2000 to 1.6% in 2016.
Turkey		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate increased from 6.5% in 2000 to 11% in 2016.
Turkey		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 0.24 kilograms in 2000 to 0.18 kilograms in 2015.
Turkey		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2014, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.86% of GDP, up from 0.47% in 2000.
Turkey		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 50% in 2000.
Turkey		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2017, 50% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.

This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Ukraine		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP decreased from 1.3 kilograms in 2000 to 0.6 kilograms in 2015.
Ukraine		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.48% of GDP.
Ukraine		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 100% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal, up from 75% in 2002.
Ukraine		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2012, 51% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Ukraine		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 18 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Ukraine		14	Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development			In 2017, 3.4% of the marine environment under national jurisdiction (up to 200 nautical miles from shore) was under protection.

Uruguay		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 8.6 micrograms per cubic metre. This is below the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.

Yemen		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 12% of GDP, down from 13% in 2000.
Yemen		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services increased from 5% in 2000 to 19% in 2015.
Yemen		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 1.6% of the population.
Zambia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line increased from 49% in 2002 to 58% in 2015.
Zambia		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			In 2015, 52%  of the country's workers and their families were living on less than 1.90 US dollars per person per day, up from 47% in 2003.
Zambia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 46% in 2015.
Zambia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2013, 40% of children under age 5 had stunted growth, a decline from 53% in 2002.
Zambia		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 was 6.2% in 2013.
Zambia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 541 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 224 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Zambia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 165 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 60 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Zambia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 410 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Zambia		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 23% in 2000 to 18% in 2016.
Zambia		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 1.2 in 2007, meaning 120 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Zambia		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 1.1 in 2006, meaning 110 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Zambia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2014, 31% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Zambia		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 10% in 2000 to 18% in 2018.
Zambia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 17% in 2000 to 27% in 2016.
Zambia		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 16% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Zambia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was 0.54% in 2016.
Zambia		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate was 7.9% in 2012.
Zambia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP were approximately 0.06 kilograms in 2015.
Zambia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2008, investment in research and development (R&D) stood at 0.28% of GDP.
Zambia		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 93% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Zambia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums declined from 57% in 2000 to 54% in 2014.
Zambia		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 25 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Zambia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 69% in 2000 to 65% in 2015.
Zambia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 56% in 2018.
Zambia		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 48% in 2018.
Zambia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, the intentional homicide rate was 5.3 per 100,000 population.
Zambia		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2014, there were about 11% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Zambia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 0.18% of GDP.
Zambia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services declined from 19% in 2000 to 7.2% in 2016.
Zambia		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 0.19% of the population.
Zimbabwe		1	End poverty in all its forms everywhere			The proportion of the population living below the extreme poverty line was approximately 21% in 2011.
Zimbabwe		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The proportion of the population suffering from hunger was 45% in 2015.
Zimbabwe		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			In 2015, 27% of children under age 5 had stunted growth.
Zimbabwe		2	End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture			The share of overweight children under age 5 decreased from 9.1% in 2005 to 5.6% in 2015.
Zimbabwe		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The maternal mortality ratio decreased from 590 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2000 to 443 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2015.
Zimbabwe		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The mortality rate of children under age 5 fell from 102 per 1,000 live births in 2000 to 50 per 1,000 live births in 2017.
Zimbabwe		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			In 2016, there were about 300 people in every 100,000 uninfected population that became newly infected with HIV.
Zimbabwe		3	Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages			The risk of dying between the ages of 30 and 70 from one of four main non-communicable diseases (NCDs) - cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease - fell from 22% in 2000 to 19% in 2016.
Zimbabwe		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			In 2013, 36% of children participated in pre-primary or primary education in the year prior to the official entrance age for primary school.
Zimbabwe		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in mathematics at the end of primary education was 0.96 in 2007, meaning 96 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in mathematics.
Zimbabwe		4	Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all			Gender parity index for achievement in reading at the end of primary education was 0.92 in 2006, meaning 92 girls per 100 boys achieved at least a minimum proficiency level in reading.
Zimbabwe		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			In 2015, 32% of women aged 20 to 24 reported that they were married before their eighteenth birthday.
Zimbabwe		5	Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls			The proportion of seats held by women in single or lower houses of parliament increased from 14% in 2000 to 33% in 2018.
Zimbabwe		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			The proportion of the population with access to electricity increased from 34% in 2000 to 38% in 2016.
Zimbabwe		7	Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all			In 2016, 29% of the population relied primarily on clean fuels and technology.
Zimbabwe		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The annual growth rate of real gross domestic product (GDP) per capita was -1.7% in 2016.
Zimbabwe		8	Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all			The total unemployment rate declined from 12% in 2002 to 5.4% in 2012.
Zimbabwe		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			The carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP increased from 0.43 kilograms in 2000 to 0.46 kilograms in 2015.
Zimbabwe		9	Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation			In 2016, 89% of the population was in range of at least a second-generation (2G) cellular signal.
Zimbabwe		10	Reduce inequality within and among countries			In 2014, 50% of GDP was from labour, comprising wages and social protection transfers.
Zimbabwe		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			The proportion of the urban population living in slums increased from 3.3% in 2000 to 25% in 2014.
Zimbabwe		11	Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable			In 2016, the annual population-weighted average mean concentration of fine suspended particles of less than 2.5 microns in diameters (PM2.5) was about 19 micrograms per cubic metre. This is above the maximum level for safety set by WHO of 10 micrograms per cubic metre.
Zimbabwe		13	Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts			As of 2015, Zimbabwe has developed national and local disaster reduction strategies.
Zimbabwe		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			Land area covered by forest declined from 49% in 2000 to 36% in 2015.
Zimbabwe		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of freshwater key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 79% in 2018.
Zimbabwe		15	Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss			The average proportion of terrestrial key biodiversity areas (KBAs) covered by protected areas was 86% in 2018.
Zimbabwe		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2012, the intentional homicide rate was 6.7 per 100,000 population.
Zimbabwe		16	Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels			In 2015, there were about 44% of children under age 5 whose births were registered with a civil authority.
Zimbabwe		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			As of 2017, Zimbabwe does not have national statistical plans that are fully funded.
Zimbabwe		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, the inflow of personal remittances was 11% of GDP, down from 14% in 2009.
Zimbabwe		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			Debt service as a proportion of exports of goods and services was 1.6% in 2015.
Zimbabwe		17	Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development			In 2016, fixed-broadband internet penetration reached 1.1% of the population.
